DataElement.preferredDefinition: Result of the participant's Herpes simplex testing.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A group of acute infections caused by herpes simplex virus type 1 or type 2 that is characterized by the development of one or more small fluid-filled vesicles with a raised erythematous base on the skin or mucous membrane. It occurs as a primary infection or recurs due to a reactivation of a latent infection. (Dorland, 27th ed.)_The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A group of acute infections caused by herpes simplex virus type 1 or type 2 that is characterized by the development of one or more small fluid-filled vesicles with a raised erythematous base on the skin or mucous membrane. It occurs as a primary infection or recurs due to a reactivation of a latent infection. (Dorland, 27th ed.)

Concepts.definition: A group of acute infections caused by herpes simplex virus type 1 or type 2 that is characterized by the development of one or more small fluid-filled vesicles with a raised erythematous base on the skin or mucous membrane. It occurs as a primary infection or recurs due to a reactivation of a latent infection. (Dorland, 27th ed.)

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to capture a list of findings following an examination or observation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

Concepts.definition: A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not yet decided or settled; awaiting conclusion or confirmation.

Concepts.definition: Not yet decided or settled; awaiting conclusion or confirmation.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates that a test was not performed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates that a test was not performed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Positive Finding Negative Finding Unknown Finding Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.:A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.:Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.:Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.
A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.
Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
